Linux Network Related Commands


Add/Remove Address With ip Commands


Add IP address


# check ip address
sudo ip a




Assume you want assign 10.1.1.10 with netmask 255.255.255.0 to device ens3


sudo ip a add 10.1.1.10/24 dev ens3




Remove Address


Remove assigned IP 10.1.1.10 from device ens3


sudo ip a del 10.1.1.10/24 dev ens3




Bring up/down NIC With ip Commands


Bring up NIC


Before you start, please make sure it was connected(use 
ethtool
 to check it).


We take 
ens3
 as example:


# Check devices link status
sudo ip l

sudo ip l set dev ens3 up




Bring down NIC


# Check devices link status
sudo ip l

sudo ip l set dev ens3 down




Scan all up host with nmap


Suppose you want to scan 172.16.0.0/24 all up hosts


sudo nmap -sn 172.16.0.0/24




It will list all up hosts and their MAC address.

Non-interactive Manipulate Disk Partitions


It might be useful, when you need to automation it in your Ansible playbook or preseed file.


Prerequiste


Let's suppose you are working on Ubuntu 14.04/16.04
Install tools gdisk with follwing command:


 sudo apt-get install -y gdisk




Remove all partitions on specific disk


Change 
/dev/sdb
 to match your device path.


 sgdisk --zap-all --clear --mbrtogpt /dev/sdb




Create single disk partiton(Linux filesystem)


You can list all support file system types with following command:


 sgdisk -L




We take 8300 (Linux filesystem) as example, and create a partition that cover all available sectors on 
/dev/sdb
.


 sgdisk -N 1 -t 1:8300  /dev/sdb




When it finish, don't forget reboot your system to take effect.
